verses.verse: Then Elihu <S%H453><s%> continued <S%H6030><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%>
"Hear <S%H8085><s%> my words, <S%H4405><s%> you wise <S%H2450><s%> men, <S%H2450><s%> And listen <S%H238><s%> to me, you who know. <S%H3045><s%>
"For the ear <S%H241><s%> tests <S%H974><s%> words, <S%H4405><s%> As the palate <S%H2441><s%> tastes <S%H2938><s%> food. <S%H398><s%>
"Let us choose <S%H977><s%> for ourselves what <S%H4941><s%> is right; <S%H4941><s%> Let us know <S%H3045><s%> among <S%H996><s%> ourselves what <S%H4100><s%> is good. <S%H2896><s%>
"For Job <S%H347><s%> has said, <S%H559><s%> 'I am righteous, <S%H6663><s%> But God <S%H410><s%> has taken <S%H5493><s%> away <S%H5493><s%> my right; <S%H4941><s%>
Should I lie <S%H3576><s%> concerning <S%H5921><s%> my right <S%H4941><s%>? My wound <S%H2671><s%> is incurable, <S%H605><s%> [though I am] without <S%H1097><s%> transgression. <S%H6588><s%>'
"What <S%H4310><s%> man <S%H1397><s%> is like Job, <S%H347><s%> Who <S%H4310><s%> drinks <S%H8354><s%> up derision <S%H3933><s%> like water, <S%H4325><s%>
Who goes <S%H732><s%> in company <S%H2274><s%> with the workers <S%H6466><s%> of iniquity, <S%H205><s%> And walks <S%H1980><s%> with wicked <S%H7562><s%> men <S%H376><s%>?
"For he has said, <S%H559><s%> 'It profits <S%H5532><s%> a man <S%H1397><s%> nothing <S%H3808><s%> When he is pleased <S%H7521><s%> with God. <S%H430><s%>'

"Therefore, <S%H3651><s%> listen <S%H8085><s%> to me, you men <S%H376><s%> of understanding. <S%H3824><s%> Far <S%H2486><s%> be it from God <S%H410><s%> to do wickedness, <S%H7562><s%> And from the Almighty <S%H7706><s%> to do wrong. <S%H5766><s%>
"For He pays <S%H9608><s%> a man <S%H120><s%> according to his work, <S%H6467><s%> And makes him find <S%H4672><s%> it according to his way. <S%H734><s%>
"Surely, <S%H637><s%> <S%H551><s%> God <S%H410><s%> will not act <S%H7561><s%> wickedly, <S%H7561><s%> And the Almighty <S%H7706><s%> will not pervert <S%H5791><s%> justice. <S%H4941><s%>

"Who <S%H4310><s%> gave <S%H6485><s%> Him authority <S%H6845><s%> over <S%H5921><s%> the earth <S%H776><s%>? And who <S%H4310><s%> has laid <S%H7760><s%> [on Him] the whole <S%H3605><s%> world <S%H8398><s%>?
"If <S%H518><s%> He should determine <S%H7760><s%> <S%H3820><s%> to do so, If He should gather <S%H622><s%> to Himself His spirit <S%H7307><s%> and His breath, <S%H5397><s%>
All <S%H3605><s%> flesh <S%H1320><s%> would perish <S%H1478><s%> together, <S%H3162><s%> And man <S%H120><s%> would return <S%H7725><s%> to dust. <S%H6083><s%>
"But if <S%H518><s%> [you have] understanding, <S%H998><s%> hear <S%H8085><s%> this; <S%H384><s%> Listen <S%H238><s%> to the sound <S%H6963><s%> of my words. <S%H4405><s%>
"Shall one who hates <S%H8130><s%> justice <S%H4941><s%> rule <S%H2280><s%>? And will you condemn <S%H7561><s%> a righteous <S%H6662><s%> mighty <S%H3524><s%> one, <S%H3524><s%>
Who says <S%H559><s%> to a king, <S%H4428><s%> 'Worthless <S%H1100><s%> one, <S%H1100><s%>' To nobles, <S%H5081><s%> 'Wicked <S%H7563><s%> ones <S%H7563><s%>';

Who <S%H834><s%> shows <S%H5375><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> partiality <S%H5375><s%> <S%H6440><s%> to princes, <S%H8269><s%> Nor <S%H3808><s%> regards <S%H5234><s%> the rich <S%H7771><s%> above <S%H6440><s%> the poor, <S%H1800><s%> For they all <S%H3605><s%> are the work <S%H4639><s%> of His hands <S%H3027><s%>?

"In a moment <S%H7281><s%> they die, <S%H4191><s%> and at midnight <S%H2676><s%> <S%H3915><s%> People <S%H5971><s%> are shaken <S%H1607><s%> and pass <S%H5674><s%> away, <S%H5674><s%> And the mighty <S%H47><s%> are taken <S%H5493><s%> away <S%H5493><s%> without <S%H3808><s%> a hand. <S%H3027><s%>
"For His eyes <S%H5869><s%> are upon the ways <S%H1870><s%> of a man, <S%H376><s%> And He sees <S%H7200><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> his steps. <S%H6806><s%>

"There <S%H369><s%> is no <S%H369><s%> darkness <S%H2822><s%> or deep <S%H6757><s%> shadow <S%H6757><s%> Where <S%H8033><s%> the workers <S%H6466><s%> of iniquity <S%H205><s%> may hide <S%H5641><s%> themselves.
"For He does not [need to] consider <S%H7760><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> further, <S%H5750><s%> That he should go <S%H1980><s%> before <S%H413><s%> God <S%H410><s%> in judgment. <S%H4941><s%>
"He breaks <S%H9570><s%> in pieces mighty <S%H3524><s%> men <S%H3524><s%> without <S%H3808><s%> inquiry, <S%H2714><s%> And sets <S%H5975><s%> others <S%H312><s%> in their place. <S%H8478><s%>
"Therefore <S%H3651><s%> He knows <S%H5234><s%> their works, <S%H4566><s%> And He overthrows <S%H2015><s%> [them] in the night, <S%H3915><s%> And they are crushed. <S%H1792><s%>
"He strikes <S%H5606><s%> them like <S%H8478><s%> the wicked <S%H7563><s%> In a public <S%H7200><s%> place, <S%H4725><s%>

Because <S%H834><s%> <S%H5921><s%> <S%H3651><s%> they turned <S%H5493><s%> aside <S%H5493><s%> from following <S%H310><s%> Him, And had <S%H7919><s%> no <S%H3808><s%> regard <S%H7919><s%> for any <S%H3605><s%> of His ways; <S%H1870><s%>
So that they caused the cry <S%H6818><s%> of the poor <S%H1800><s%> to come <S%H935><s%> to Him, And that He might hear <S%H8085><s%> the cry <S%H6818><s%> of the afflicted <S%H6041><s%> –

When He keeps <S%H8252><s%> quiet, <S%H8252><s%> who <S%H4310><s%> then can condemn <S%H7561><s%>? And when He hides <S%H5641><s%> His face, <S%H6440><s%> who <S%H4310><s%> then can behold <S%H7789><s%> Him, That is, in regard <S%H5921><s%> to both <S%H3162><s%> nation <S%H1471><s%> and man <S%H120><s%>? –
So <S%H4480><s%> that godless <S%H2611><s%> men <S%H120><s%> should not rule, <S%H4427><s%> Nor <S%H4480><s%> be snares <S%H4170><s%> of the people. <S%H5971><s%>
"For has anyone said <S%H559><s%> to God, <S%H410><s%> 'I have borne <S%H5375><s%> [chastisement;] I will not offend <S%H2254><s%> [anymore;]
Teach <S%H3384><s%> Thou me what I do not see; <S%H2372><s%> If <S%H518><s%> I have done <S%H6466><s%> iniquity, <S%H5766><s%> I will do <S%H3254><s%> it no <S%H3808><s%> more <S%H3254><s%>'?

"Shall He recompense <S%H9608><s%> on your terms, <S%H5973><s%> because <S%H3588><s%> you have rejected <S%H3988><s%> [it?] For you must choose, <S%H977><s%> and not I; Therefore declare <S%H1696><s%> what <S%H4100><s%> you know. <S%H3045><s%>
"Men <S%H376><s%> of understanding <S%H3824><s%> will say <S%H559><s%> to me, And a wise <S%H2450><s%> man <S%H1397><s%> who hears <S%H8085><s%> me,
'Job <S%H347><s%> speaks <S%H1696><s%> without <S%H3808><s%> knowledge, <S%H1847><s%> And his words <S%H1697><s%> are without <S%H3808><s%> wisdom. <S%H7919><s%>
'Job <S%H347><s%> ought <S%H9049><s%> to be tried <S%H974><s%> to the limit, <S%H5331><s%> Because <S%H5921><s%> he answers <S%H8666><s%> like wicked <S%H205><s%> men. <S%H376><s%>

'For he adds <S%H3254><s%> rebellion <S%H6588><s%> to his sin; <S%H9128><s%> He claps <S%H5606><s%> his hands among <S%H996><s%> us, And multiplies <S%H7235><s%> his words <S%H561><s%> against God. <S%H410><s%>' "
